review: This is an incredible value for the price.  It installed easily, and streaming YouTube, my Netflix and Amazon Prime are a cinch.  BUT the instructions included with the Chromecast are nearly non-existent, and I have yet to figure out how to stream other content from my computer, such as my pictures library.  I don't use cable or satellite at all.  Just Roku and an antenna for local broadcast stations, so I had contemplated buying a device to stream from my computer for a long time.  But I kept reading reviews about how difficult it was for many people to get the streaming devices to work with their systems, and most of them cost $100 or more.  When I saw the Chromecast for $35, I figured, "What th heck - at that price, I'll give it a try".  I'm very glad I did.  And BTW - you can take it with you when you travel.  I recently stayed a t a very nice hotel, but their free cable offerings were very limited.  But with the hotel's free wi-fi, my netbook & chromecast, everything I would watch at home was available.
author: Earth Mother "Earth Mother"

review: This little fob is AWESOME.  We travel quite a bit and only take our ipad with Netflix.  Now kids can watch their Netflix movies & shows on the TV instead of huddling around a little screen, and we can watch documentaries, series, etc while we're away from home.  You have to make sure TV has proper HDMI input.  Sometimes can be a little finicky to setup but once you figure it out youre good. Sometimes would disconnect after non-use for a day or two, but just unplugged everything to reset and it reconnected no problem.
